headline.main: Oyer and Terminer.; DECISION IN THE DEVLIN CASE SECOND TRIAL OF DAVID BEACH FOR THE HEAYY FORGERY, IN THE NAME OF ROBERT BONNER OF THE LEDGER, ON THE NASSAU BANK IMPORTANT PRESENTMENT BY THE GRAND JURY ON THE RECENT CHANGE IN THE LAW RELATING TO CAPITAL PUNISHMENT.

docs.lead_paragraph: Judge GOULD sat yesterday in this Court, and, at its opening, read a brief decision, denying the motion to cuash the indictment in the case of Charles Devlin; and Mr. Graham announced his intention of applying for a certiorari to carry the case to the General Term of the Supreme Court.

headline.main: FROM HAVANA.; Change in the Mode of Purchasing Sugar The Bank More Slavers Miscellaneous.

docs.lead_paragraph: The merchants in foreign countries, particularly in the north of Europe, having of late objected to purchase cargoes of sugar exported from this Island by the invoice weight, in consequence of the weight of the sugar boxes used at this time being found to be much greater than it was some years ago, when the fare of each box of sugar was fixed at fortyseven pounds, two pounds additional being added for

docs.snippet: The official visit of the Prince of Wales was to lay the last stone of the seven-and-a-halfmillion-dollar Victoria Bridge, or, in other words, the tombstone of the Grand Trunk Railway. The Toronto Leader at length informs us that "it cannot be longer...

headline.main: A Royal Funeral British and American Engineering.

docs.lead_paragraph: The official visit of the Prince of Wales was to lay the last stone of the seven-and-a-halfmillion-dollar Victoria Bridge, or, in other words, the tombstone of the Grand Trunk Railway. The Toronto Leader at length informs us that "it cannot be longer concealed that a tremendous financial catastrophe is impending over the road, BARING BROTHERS having taken steps to recover advances amounting to millions of dollars."

docs.snippet: Nothing of interest has been heard from WALKER for some time, and all excitement here regarding his invasion has died away. The reinforcement of Government troops ordered to the borders of Nicaragua have been withdrawn, and matters have settled down...

headline.main: NICARAGUA.; Walker's Failure President Martinez Resumes the Presidency The Meeting of the Nicaraguan Congrees The Treaty with the United States The Transit Question American Enterprise in Nicaragua.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nothing of interest has been heard from WALKER for some time, and all excitement here regarding his invasion has died away. The reinforcement of Government troops ordered to the borders of Nicaragua have been withdrawn, and matters have settled down quietly.
